basics.name: Sergio Lozano Alvarez
basics.label: Product Marketing Manager
basics.summary: Product Marketing Manager with 10+ years of experience in marketing and CX, skilled in product launches and go-to-market strategies

work.name: Logpoint
work.summary: I led the go-to-market strategy for multiple cybersecurity products, developed product positioning, product messaging, value proposition, and sales enablement materials, and managed over 10 product launches and the launch of one pricing and packaging to drive sales and generate leads.
highlights: Product Marketing, Sales Enablement, Go-To-Market Strategy, Positioning, Pipeline Acceleration, Account-Based Marketing

work.name: SumUp
work.summary: I led the CX squad and established a customer-centric culture at SumUp Invoices to drive product and marketing improvements and reduce churn by leveraging customer insights, defining and implementing CX strategies, such as first-ever customer journey maps in SumUp, customer feedback loop programs, NPS, CSAT, and CES.
highlights: Customer Experience, Agile Project Management, Design Thinking, Business Analysis

work.name: SumUp
work.position: Regional Marketing Manager - Team Lead UK, ES, IT, DK
work.summary: I led the marketing strategy for SumUp Invoices and Accounting in four regions by driving growth through product marketing, demand generation, and customer success. I contributed to the launch of SumUp Invoices in different markets and managed a team of 8 marketing professionals I have seen grow throughout the years.
highlights: Content Marketing, Go-To-Market Strategies, Growth Marketing, SEO &  PPC, Email Marketing

work.name: SumUp
work.summary: Through engaging written and visual content, I facilitated organic growth and enabled the go-to-market strategies for the launch of new features and products and, ultimately, the announcement of SumUp’s acquisition of Debitoor.
highlights: Content Marketing, Growth Marketing, SEO &  PPC, Email Marketing, Brand Design

work.name: Visma E-Conomic
work.summary: I contributed to various marketing activities, including content creation, social media management, online marketing, product marketing, graphic design, video editing, and customer support and sales.
highlights: Content Marketing, Growth Marketing, SEO, Email Marketing

volunteer.summary: For over two years, I contributed to the brand design of the NGO Fundación Salvador Soler. I audited their website and brand content and created and brand guideliness and recommendations. I also designed logos for the cooperation forums, produced and designed their annual reports, and created designs for banners, posters, and merchandising

education.studyType: MA in International Business Communication (Multicultural Communication in Organisations)

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
